Event.description: Come talk to Tripwire, Torn Banner, Digital Roar (and we are open to others!) about our companies, games, and the future. How we got our starts, crowd sourcing, modding (and how it can work for you both as a start and for continued growth to your existing games!), where we are today, and more. Why we have made certain decisions and experiments and why we continue to do so as we move our companies forward. Want a job? Find out what we look for! -- Panelists: Jared Creasy [Tripwire Interactive, Community Manager], Alan Wilson [Tripwire Interactive, Vice President], Steve Piggott [President, Tom Banner], John Lyons [CEO, Digital Roar], Zachariah Inks [Creative Director, Digital Roar]
Event.name: Ask Us Anything - Successful and Upcoming Indie Game Companies

Event.description: Have you ever considered dressing up as your favorite video game character at PAX, but didn’t know where to start? Join our panel of experienced costume and prop makers as we tackle costume building do’s and don’ts, con costume etiquette and answer all of your costume and prop related questions. -- Panelists: Bill Doran [Prop/Costume Maker, Punished Props], Holly Conrad [Creature Designer/Armor Maker, Crabcat Industries], Jessica Merizan [Crabcat Industries XO, Crabcat Industries], Rob Doran [Costumer/Teacher], Jackie Goehner [Costume Maker/Cosplayer]
Event.name: Con Costuming: A Survival Guide

Event.description: Blizzard has a little something new, and they’re bringing it to PAX East! It’s different from their other games, so it’s not a sequel, expansion, or that rumored next-gen MMO. Be among the first to see what the legendary development studio has been working on in this presentation.
Event.name: Blizzard Entertainment Presents

Event.description: Monster Hunter, one of the most successful portable game series in the history of Japan, has slowly been developing a dedicated and obsessed American fan base. But what makes this game so addicting? In this panel we will go over the history of the Monster Hunter franchise as well as game mechanics, skills, tips, and guides for those interested in starting a career in one of the most challenging and rewarding games of the past ten years. -- Panelists: Cory Privitera [Lead Blogger, Tokyo Hipster]
Event.name: So You Want to be a Monster Hunter?: An Introduction

Event.description: Each player receives a Gatecrash Intro Pack. Prize cards every 3rd match.
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering Convention League

Event.description: You probably know Bleszinski from his work on the Jazz Jackrabbit games (and in particular, Jazz Jackrabbit: Holiday Hare), but those hardcore Cliff fans may also recognize his name from the obscure indie darlings, Gears of War and Unreal. Currently unemployed and struggling off welfare, Cliff lives out of his Lamborghini in North Carolina bumming for keynote gigs. Join us as we welcome his no doubt fascinating tale to PAX East 2013!
Event.name: Storytime with Cliff Bleszinski

Event.description: Want to play a D&D game without a DM? Do you like cooperative games? How about head-to-head Euro-style games? Or casual dungeon delves? Come with your friends to play any of our D&D themed board games all weekend long! Stop in anytime to select from Dungeon, Castle Ravenloft, Wrath of Ashardalon, The Legend of Drizzt, or Lords of Waterdeep!
Event.name: D&D Board Game Open Play

Event.description: Each Player receives 4 Gatecrash boosters and plays a 30 card deck.
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering 4 Booster Sealed Deck

Event.description: Winning the PAX East Game is back! The team from Metagame Theory returns to break down the strategies and tactics you’ll need to win this weekend’s ultimate game…PAX East itself. PAX East is a massively multiplayer cross-platform cross-genre megalith that could stymie even the strongest of gamers. Join the MGT Podcast Team as they reveal opening patterns, high traffic areas, panel builds, show floor strategies, tournament details, tabletop tactics, main quests, side quests, twitter feeds, fan meetups, the local bar tour, and more! Whether you’re a novice or a grizzled veteran, a video gamer or tabletop strategist, don’t miss this player’s guide to beating PAX East 2013. -- Panelists: Joe O’Brien [Producer, Co-Host, Metagame Theory], Brian McDermott [Co-Host, Metagame Theory], Tom Gisondi [Writer, Co-Host, Metagame Theory], Troy Lavallee [Contributor, Metagame Theory]
Event.name: Winning the PAX East Game

Event.description: Bring your glowsticks and LED glasses, because Friday and Saturday is the PAX East 2013 Chiptune Showcase! Featuring twelve all-star 8-Bit and chiptune acts from across the country Friday and Saturday in the Jamspace room. -- Panelists: DJ Cutman, Disasterpeace, BRIGHT PRIMATE, and Special Guests TBA!
Event.name: Boston 8-Bit Presents: PAX 2013 Chiptune Showcase, Part 1

Event.description: Who needs a job anyway? In the age of independence, game journalists are creating unique and interesting content away from the constraints of the traditional press model. This panel will discuss the opportunities, methods, and benefits of breaking away from the system and producing profitable works without the need for an established outlet. -- Panelists: Justin Amirkhani [Writer, GamerUnplugged.com], HipHopGamer [Owner, HipHopGamerShow.com], Neal Ronaghan [Editor, Nintendo Force Magazine], Kyle McIntosh [Curator, GoodGamesWriting.com]
Event.name: Games Journalism in the Age of Independence

Event.description: By now you know where Nerdcore began, but Mega Ran and MC Frontalot will tell you about the next level and new generation of nerdcore artists, how to get started, and what the future holds for the subgenre. -- Panelists: Raheem Jarbo [Musician, RandomBeats, LLC], Damian Hess [Musician, Level Up Records and Tapes], Kyle Murdock [Producer, Neosonic Productions], Melvin Raymond [DJ/Producer, One Beagle Productions]
Event.name: Nerdcore Hip-Hop: Rising Up

Event.description: Immediately after Storytime with Cliff Bleszinski, stick around for a Q&A session featuring Gabe and Tycho of Penny Arcade! Two mics, one heck of a time! And please, no “who would win in a fight” questions. Also note that if you can’t make it to this panel, there’s another one on Sunday at 2:00 in Main Theater. These guys are givers. They give. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A

Event.description: Crystal Dynamics brings together some of the talented development team members from various backgrounds who worked on TOMB RAIDER. The discussion will dive deep into their roles, responsibilities, and perspectives on recreating Lara Croft. Moderated by Susan Arendt from the Escapist, an audience Q&A will follow the panel. -- Panelists: Susan Arendt [Editor-in-Chief, The Escapist], Kam Zambell [Producer, Crystal Dynamics], Kari Hattner [Associate Producer, Crystal Dynamics], Nicole Tan [Artist, Crystal Dynamics], Megan Marie [Community Manager, Crystal Dynamics]
Event.name: Recreating an Icon: The Talent Behind the New Lara Croft in TOMB RAIDER
Ticket to Ride Qualifier Block A Tournament

Event.description: Games are changing the way education works. The Gates Foundation, the US army & many other powerful groups are using them in ground breaking new ways, directly influencing the current American curriculum. -- Panelists: One day, very soon, you’re going to be able to pull out your iPad, anywhere in the world, and try for a high-score in school.
Event.name: Game Designers Are Defining the Next 50 Years of Education

Event.description: 1v1 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Persona 4 Arena Tournament

Event.description: Moderator Francis Mao (CAPCOM) leads a panel of Capcom’s producers and product managers to share the latest details on all the upcoming Capcom games such as Remember Me, Lost Planet 3, Resident Evil Revelations, Dragon’s Dogma: Dark Arisen, two NEW product announcements, and more! Up to 1,000 fans will walk away with a free gift, so this is a panel you definitely do not want to miss!
Event.name: World of Capcom

Event.description: Each player receives 1 Booster each of Innistrad, Dark Ascension, Avacyn Restored,Magic 2013, Return to Ravinca, Gatecrash
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering Sealed Deck from Standard Boosters

Event.description: Want to get more StreetPass tags and learn how to maximize the amount of tags in your community? Then join the StreetPass panel as we show you how streetpass groups are forming in places near you. We will look at Princeton, Long Island, San Diego, and more!!! Also learn from one of the developers at Island Officials how StreetPass can be used to enhance a game’s experience. Prizes and video game art will be given away so don’t miss this awesome panel! -- Panelists: Nicholas Oehlberg [Co-founder, Streetpass Princeton], Robert Oehlberg [Founder, Streetpass Princeton], Debbie Gluzband [Co-Founder, Streetpass Long Island], Isaiah TriForce Johnson [CEO and Founder, Empire Arcadia], Ryan Morrison [Software Engineer, Island Officials]
Event.name: Streetpass Network: Bridging Gamers Within the Community!

Event.description: Vincent Baker (Dogs in the Vineyard, Apocalypse World), Meg Baker (Psi Run, 1001 Nights) and Luke Crane (Burning Wheel, Mouse Guard) take you on a journey, much like the Small World ride at Disney World. On this journey you will hear tales both sweet and sad about why you should make and publish your own (tabletop) games. Then we sing! -- Panelists: Luke Crane [Game Designer, Burning Wheel], Vincent Baker [Game Designer, Lumpley Games], Meg Baker [Game Designer, Night Sky Games]
Event.name: We Make and Publish Our Own Games…and It Is Rad

Event.description: 2013 is an exciting year for FINAL FANTASY fans, with an upcoming release of FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. Join the SQUARE ENIX team as they give an inside scoop on new details for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. -- Panelists: David Yang [Senior PR Manager, Square Enix, Inc.], Morten Haugaard [Product Manager, Square Enix, Inc.]
Event.name: Final Fantasy PAX East Panel

Event.description: Video games marketing is a rare beast. The skill sets and types of people that publishers and agencies look to hire are not only different from other industries, but rapidly changing. -- Panelists: So whether it’s advertising, PR, community, or media that interests you, join industry veterans for a discussion on how you can jump start your career in video games marketing and Q&A to hear advice on your specific dream job.
Event.name: Get Hired in Video Games Marketing

Event.description: 1v1 64 Player Cap
Event.name: Marvel vs. Capcom 3 Ultimate Tournament

Event.description: Join Rooster Teeth Productions as they showcase some world premiere news! Watch a sneak peek of some brand new RWBY content and get caught up on various other shenanigans from the RT office. Panel members include Gus Sorola and some other people you probably don’t care about.
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: Have an 8-bit melody in your head? Listen to stories from the ones who get paid to do it, find out what gear to grab, what programs work best, and see if it’s still for you. Featuring chip artists Mega Ran, Danimal Cannon and many more. -- Panelists: Raheem Jarbo [Musician/Producer, RandomBeats, LLC], Dan Behrens [Musician/Producer, Danimal Cannon], James Therrien [Musician/Producer, Bright Primate], Lydia Marsala Esrig [Musician, Bright Primate]
Event.name: So You Want To Make Chiptunes?

Event.description: Join FoxTrot cartoonist Bill Amend as he updates us on his ongoing mission to inject gaming and geekery into North America’s newspapers -- Panelists: Bill Amend [FoxTrot]
Event.name: The Return of the Return of Bill Amend

Event.description: What could be more fun than making music and sound for video games? Well, how about making a living off of it? If you’ve been dabbling in music, sound, or both and want to break into the world of game audio then you’re in luck! This lecture will discuss the ins and outs of game audio, while also giving the practical knowledge you need to travel down this wonderful career path. -- Panelists: Akash Thakkar [Composer/Sound Designer]
Event.name: Game Audio: From Hobbyist to Professional

Event.description: What do you get when you pair four fun and highly-acclaimed local multiplayer games and throw in a Kickstarter campaign? Sportsfriends! Join the developers behind Johann Sebastian Joust, BaraBariBall, and Hokra for a panel discussion moderated by journalist Ben Kuchera (Penny Arcade Report) as they talk through the origins of their collaboration, their successful Kickstarter campaign, and the burgeoning reemergence of indie games designed specifically around local multiplayer. -- Panelists: Douglas Wilson [Lead Game Designer & Partner, Die Gute Fabrik], Ramiro Corbetta, Noah Sasso, Ben Kuchera [Senior Editor, Penny Arcade Report]
Event.name: Sportsfriends, Indie Collaboration, and Local Multiplayer

Event.description: 1v1 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Budokai HD Collection Tournament

Event.description: Join Luke, Meg and Vincent as they try to guess what’s coming, why, and how to get in on it. Guaranteed minimum wrongness: 90%. -- Panelists: Luke Crane [Game Designer, Burning Wheel], Vincent Baker [Game Designer, Lumpley Games], Meg Baker [Game Designer, Night Sky Games]
Event.name: The Future of RPG Design and Publishing

Event.description: Our internet culture encourages participation but can discourage meaningful interaction. If you are suffering from depression or anxiety, the internet and gaming culture can make your frustrating symptoms of alienation feel worse. You may be surrounded by “friends” but yet unable to find one who will listen or understand. What you need is to know that you are not alone. Many others have gone through what you are experiencing, and we are here to share our stories with you. Join the members of the Take This Project for an hour of inspirational stories of depression and healing and advice for when it is time to seek help and how to do so. It’s dangerous to go alone. -- Panelists: Russ Pitts [Organizer, Take This], Mark Klein PsyD. [Psychologist, The Human Relations Service], Susan Arendt [Editor-in-Chief, The Escapist], Sean Sands [Co-Founder, Gamers With Jobs], Sarah LeBoeuf [Writer, The Escapist]
Event.name: It’s Dangerous to Go Alone - The Take This Panel

Event.description: We here at PAX run a clean race. We also run an easy race! If you’re new to it, this just means grand prix races with random courses and no character or car restrictions. See? Easy peasy.
Event.name: Mario Kart 7 Tournament

Event.description: Before there were shooters, RPG and RTS games, there were turn-based games. Long before video games were even a possibility, most games were turn-based (game of Go, anyone?). The last decade has seen a steep decline in high-profile turn-based video games on the computer, and they are all but non-existent on consoles. However, the recent highly successful reboot of Firaxis’ XCOM: Enemy Unknown has raised the profile of turn-based games among the general gamer population, but in reality many people have been playing them all along. From the wargame crowd and small indie developers, to the serious games developers making use of asymmetrical gameplay in schools and business, turn-based games have been thriving despite being below the radar of most gamers. Until now. Will other AAA developers try to emulate XCOM’s success? What about social games and tablets? Our panel brings together TB developers and strategy game veterans to discuss how widespread the use of turn-based games is and has been, what’s happening right now, and what we might expect to see in the future. -- Panelists: Chris Parsons [Product Manager, Muzzy Lane], Troy Goodfellow [PR Rep, Creater of, Evolve PR], Justin Korthof [Community Manager, Robot Entertainment], Andy Moore [Captain, Radial Games], Jon Shafer [President, Conifer Games, Conifer Games, Stardock, Firaxis]
Event.name: Return of the TURN-BASED GAMES!!! (Actually they never went away)

Event.description: Can games ever tell good stories without making the player feel they’re being dragged around by the nose? Sure they can. But it’s going to mean taking some risks and trying stuff out, in a way that only indie devs can do. Our panelists are all working on adventure games and interactive stories, and we’ll be talking about the difficulties and opportunities of inventing good game narrative from the ground up, when there’s no-one looking over your shoulder. -- Panelists: Jon Ingold [Co-founder, Creative Director, inkle], Phil Tossell [Game Creator, Nyamyam], Andrew Plotkin [Interactive Fiction Writer], Dave Gilbert [Game Designer, Wadjet Eye Games], Stephen Hewitt [Co-founder, Head of Design, Blazing Griffin], Oded Sharon [CEO, Adventure Mob]
Event.name: Want a Good Story in Your Game? Get an Indie!

Event.description: Join Mike, Jerry, Graham, and most of the cast from the new hit PATV reality show, Strip Search! There may be secrets revealed, possibly in the form of video. Q&A to follow.
Event.name: Strip Search

Event.description: 4 Way FFA, 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Goldeneye Tournament

Event.description: What’s it like out there for transgender people in the gaming industry? Join our panel of industry personnel as they share coming out stories, job retention expectations, and their experiences of working while Trans. Learn a bit about what to expect when you’re working WITH someone who is Trans as well. -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Writer, www.DoEE.us], Katelynn Cusanelli [Actress, MTV Networks], Jennell Jaquays [CEO, Olde Skuul], Rebecca Heineman [Founding Member, Interplay]
Event.name: Press XY Presents: We Accept You… Just Don’t Use the Bathroom

Event.description: Join the Carbine Studios team aboard the Gambler’s Ruin as they dive into what makes WildStar different from any other MMOs you’ve played before. Learn more about the mysterious planet Nexus, see new reveals, ask questions of the developers, and maybe even get free stuff! Who doesn’t like free stuff? Plus, Curse will be introducing their tools and features to the community, and discussing future plans to support WildStar. -- Panelists: Jeremy Gaffney [Executive Producer, Carbine Studio], Troy Hewitt [Community Director, Carbine Studio], Chad Moore [Lead Narrative Designer, Carbine Studio], Mike Donatelli [Content Director, Carbine Studio]
Event.name: WildStar: Journey To Nexus

Event.description: From allegories to science fiction and comic books, narrative and virtual worlds have long been both a vital means to envision a better world and to conceptualize tools and methods for the future. Today gaming is relentlessly pursued as an important educational and rehabilitative tool. For some it holds the potential to effectively ameliorate lives severely impeded by learning issues while providing access to experiences often limited in the physical world for others. Regardless of disability, game design is the key to opening a world that provides undeniably important environments removed from judgement and rife with the important skills and strategies that are transferable across life. Yet today, non-traditional learners and gamers with disabilities as well as developers who envision their designs as a means to improve the lives of others feel equally frustrated by a disconnect in the design process. We invite you to help us unite artists and developers with non-traditional learners and gamers with disabilities in order to design better UI and UX to effect better access to these vital life altering tools. Audience members will be encouraged to tweet suggestions or questions on either side of the discussion to help create a list of needs and suggestions via twitter under the hashtag #paxdesignadvocacy to the name @Hackcessability. -- Panelists: Mark Barrett [Artist, Pop Cap Games], James Portnow [CEO, Rainmaker Games], Don ‘Jake’ Etgeton [Senior User Experience Designer, Disney Interactive], Angela Puccini [Disability and Gaming Advocate, Hackcessability], Angela Chang [CEO/Developer, Tinkerstories], AJ Glasser [Managing Editor, Inside Network]
Event.name: Designing to Do Good

Event.description: Our panel of experienced designers, editors, artists, and trained nerds talk about their experiences working on both personal and company-owned settings including the Midgard, Experiment073, and 3 Generations After the End. Topics include finding where to start, working with other creators, reinterpreting existing work, and knowing when to stop creating. -- Panelists: Brian Liberge [Game Designer, Freelance], Jim White [Editor/Writer/Designer, Freelance], Kaitlynn Peavler [Artist, Freelance], Casey Peavler, Art Vaccarino
Event.name: Worldbuilding 101

Event.description: 1v1 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Lumines Live!

Event.description: Surprisingly, we’ve only used this game in an Omegathon once before despite being a 4-player classic. Here’s a hint for this round: We won’t be using the standard rule set. 8 teams will be eliminated this round!
Event.name: Omegathon Round 1: Bomberman Live!
Race for the Galaxy Qualifier Block A

Event.description: Ninety-seven percent of all adolescents in the US play video games, & more than half of the adults in this country play video games regardless of their race or income. The military has discovered that video games decrease symptoms of PTSD in veterans, & with the advent of the iPhone, mobile technology is making social media more prevalent than ever. Despite these numbers, psychotherapists & other healthcare providers are reluctant & uncertain how or when to integrate technology into their work. When gaming or technology is mentioned at all, it is only as an addiction or liability, never as a powerful innovation. This is in part due to an age-old mistrust & disdain of technology which has its roots in issues of class & psychology. But despite this, psychotherapy has passed the point where learning about technology is negotiable. This workshop aims to critique the idea of gaming as addiction & further, discuss how understanding and using video games may improve therapeutic outcomes. -- Panelists: Michael Langlois [Mike Langlois, LICSW]
Event.name: Rethinking Gaming Addiction
Settlers of Catan Qualifier Block A

Event.description: Ever wonder what it takes to create a successful indie game studio? Boston-area indies discuss the ups and downs of breaking in and making it. Hear about the challenges and opportunities directly from those who are living it every day, from established local independent studios with multiple titles under their belts to newer studios on the verge of making it big. The panel will discuss not just what it is like to do business as an indie, but what it is like to do business as an indie surrounded by the wicked awesome Massachusetts game development community. -- Panelists: Tim Loew [Executive Director, MassDiGI], Monty Sharma [Managing Director, MassDiGI], Jon Radoff [CEO & Founder, Disruptor Beam], Albert Reed [CEO & Co-founder, Demiurge Studios], Jamie Gotch [CEO & Co-founder, Subatomic Studios], Alex Schwartz [Chief Scientist & Founder, Owlchemy Labs], Ichiro Lambe [President & Founder, Dejobaan Games], Becky Taylor [Marketing Associate, Stomp Games & Recent Graduate], Seth Sivak [CEO & Founder, Proletariat], Jen MacLean [Consultant]
Event.name: This (Boston) Indie Life: From Breaking In to Making It

Event.description: The Hosts of The Shaft have been there from the beginning of minecraft, talking with Notch, over 100 minecraft guests, and youtube celebrities. Come listen as we discuss and talk about what made Minecraft so great and where it’s going in the next few years. -- Panelists: Brent Copeland [Host, Dead Workers Party, inc], Eric Fullerton [Host, Dead Workers Party, inc], Wes Wilson [Host, Dead Workers Party, inc], Mark Cooper [Information Specialist, Dead Workers Party, inc]
Event.name: The Shaft: Digging up all the Minecraft Nuggets

Event.description: D&D Next is coming! Hoards of fans have already signed up for this monumental playtest and are helping to shape the next iteration of the Dungeons & Dragons game. Don’t miss this chance to hear how fan feedback is impacting the tabletop roleplaying game and where we’re at in the design process. In addition, you’ll get the download on D&D’s digital future including exciting new games like Neverwinter - the free, action MMORPG from Perfect World Entertainment and Baldur’s Gate II: Enhanced Edition by Beamdog. And maybe, just maybe, a very enticing new D&D offering coming soon to the digital space will be revealed. -- Panelists: Mike Mearls [Senior Manager, WOTC], Chris Perkins [Senior Producer, WOTC]
Event.name: The Future of Dungeons & Dragons

Event.description: Halo 4 delivered a unique set of multiplayer experiences, immersing players in an episodic campaign with Spartan Ops, while delivering more breadth and depth in the expanded War Games sandbox. You’ve played the Majestic Map Pack and may even have had a chance to play Castle Map Pack on the floor here at PAX. Come prepared to hear 343 Industries’ Frank O’Connor, Kevin Franklin, Dan Ayoub and David Ellis, as well as Certain Affinity’s Tom Potter discuss where we’ve been, where we are, and what is on the horizon for Halo 4 Multiplayer. -- Panelists: Frank O’Connor [343 Industries], Kevin Franklin [343 Industries], Dan Ayoub [343 Industries], David Ellis [343 Industries], Tom Potter [Certain Affinity]
Event.name: Halo 4 Multiplayer: Past, Present, and Future

Event.description: Professional game developers may spend thousands of man-hours testing their rules, but odds are they’ve never played with you and your friends. At your table or on your server, house rules can give a game new life or at least keep the social dynamic from spiraling out of control. Join pen & paper RPG developers Art Frederick and Joe Hills, Feed the Beast Minecraft modpack founder Slowpoke, and Youtube’s Guude Boulderfist, the creator of the popular Minecraft server Mindcrack, as they chat about their favorite house rules and recommendations to help you write your own! -- Panelists: Joe Hills [Partner, Team Snow Day], Art Frederick [Partner, Team Snow Day], Guude [Founder, Mindcrack], Kevin [Lead, Feed the Beast]
Event.name: House Rules: Taking games one step further

Event.description: 4 Way FFA, 64 Player Cap
Event.name: Kirby’s Dream Collection Tournament

Event.description: League of Legends employs a neuroscientist and a psychologist to keep people playing nice, and a democratically elected player council helps guide EVE Online development. The community’s voice matters in game development, marketing, live services, game enhancements and more. Learn how user-generated content, eSports and community participation can make a great game a classic as community managers from premiere game companies including Capcom’s Brett Elston, Bethesda’s Matt Grandstaff, and Ubisoft’s Gabe Graziani join Raptr’s director of community Demian Linn. Moderated by Machinima editor-in-chief Rob Smith, panelists will discuss the importance of serving the community, player-focused design and reveal a peek at what the panelists have in store for fans this year. -- Panelists: Brett Elston [Community Manager, Capcom], Gabe Graziani [Senior Community Developer, Ubisoft], Matt Grandstaff [Community Manager, Bethesda], Sveinn Johannesson Kjarval [Community Developer, CCP], Rob Smith [Editor-in-Chief, Machinima], Demian Linn [Director of Community, Raptr]
Event.name: Community: The Most Important Bullet Point Not on the Box

Event.description: MMORPG.com brings together some of the top games and developers in the industry to discuss the next decade of online games and their growing mass market appeal. Game Developers from some of the top online games including: Elder Scrolls Online, Guild Wars 2, Pirate 101, WildStar, EverQuest Next, and Neverwinter will be on hand to answer fan questions and talk about the new games coming out for 2013 and beyond. -- Panelists: Garrett Fuller [Industry Relations, MMORPG.com], Matt Firor [General Manager, ZeniMax Online], Fred Howard [VP of Marketing, KingsIsle Entertainment], Dave Georgeson [Director of Development, Sony Online Entertainment], Jon Peters [Lead Designer, ArenaNet], Jeremy Gaffney [Executive Producer, Carbine Studios], Andy Velasquez [Lead Producer, Perfect World]
Event.name: Future of Online Games Panel

Event.description: There have been success stories and colossal failures when it comes to applying principles of gamification to various different fields. However, schools and education could greatly benefit from some of the best ideas that the gaming world has generated. One example is the creation of Educational Badges. Mozilla and the MacArthur Foundation have both recently begun to invest in use of badges as a new resume/diploma. Join some of the leading scientific researchers who are currently exploring this area to discuss how badges could be and should be used in learning. -- Panelists: Sam Abramovich [Researcher, University of Pittsburgh], Peter Wardrip [Researcher, University of Pittsburgh], Yoon Jeon Kim [Researcher, Florida State University], Ross Higashi [Roboticist, National Robotics Engineering Center], Meghan Bathgate [Researcher, University of Pittsburgh]
Event.name: Gamification and Learning: Does Education Need Some ‘Stinking’ Badges?

Event.description: Videogames have traditionally done their best to ignore parents - if they’re around at all, it’s just to give the real hero his lunch before he heads off to save the world. Recently, games as diverse as Papo & Yo, Heavy Rain, Persona 4 Golden, and The Walking Dead have shown that parents can have an immense impact on a character - or player’s - life. During this discussion, we’ll examine the growing role of parents as characters in videogames, and how that might impact the kinds of stories that are told, and how real-life parents might interact with their game-playing kids. Moderated by Susan Arendt (The Escapist), featuring gaming parents Ben Kuchera (Penny Arcade Report), Brian Crecente (Polygon), and Mike Laidlaw (BioWare). -- Panelists: Susan Arendt [Editor-in-Chief, The Escapist], Brian Crecente [New Editor, Polygon], Ben Kuchera [Senior Editor, Penny Arcade Report], Mike Laidlaw [Creative Director, BioWare]
Event.name: Parents as Characters

Event.description: Are you a goal driven gamer that collects trophies or achievement points? Do you make up back stories for your game characters or think about how and why they do what they do? Do you create a version of yourself when you game with avatars that look or act like you do out of game? Come to this interactive panel hosted by Dr. Regina McMenomy and Rhonda Olgesby, hosts of the Game on Girl podcast, as they help you learn more about yourself through your gamer type. -- Panelists: Regina McMenomy [Host, Game on Girl], Rhonda Oglesby [Host, Game on Girl]
Event.name: What’s Your Gamer Type?

Event.description: With over 4,000 songs released during a 5 year run of weekly DLC, Rock Band has included songs by a veritable who’s who of the greatest musicians in the history of rock. Rock Band’s catalog includes hundreds of artists, and there are countless others that they attempted to get in the game. Oh, which bands? Yep, them. Oh yeah, them too. Definitely those guys. Interested in hearing more? Join Harmonix for a candid look behind the soundtrack of the highest rated music games ever released, as they finally respond to long burning community questions, comment on unreleased projects, and dish on all the dirt behind your favorite music games. -- Panelists: Aaron Trites [Manager, Community Development, Harmonix], John Drake [Director of Communications & Brand Management, Harmonix], Eric Pope [Community Manager, Harmonix], Chris Rigopulos [VP Music and Strategy, Harmonix]
Event.name: Rock Band Behind the Music: A Music Gaming Tell All

Event.description: Roleplaying games are awesome. They are the best type of game ever. They do things that academics can’t explain and corporations pay millions of dollars to replicate. Drawing on the study, theory and practice of both play and design, Jared Sorensen (Action Castle, Lacuna, Inspectres) and Luke Crane (Burning Wheel, Mouse Guard) dissect the blood and guts of RPGs, explaining why RPGs have always been and always will be an underground phenomenon - and why this makes them awesome. -- Panelists: Luke Crane [Burning Wheel], Jared Sorensen [Memento-Mori Theatriks]
Event.name: RPGs Are Awesome

Event.description: 1v1, 32 Player Cap
Event.name: Soul Calibur V Tournament

Event.description: Many who call themselves dorks want a high wall around their culture keeping everyone out. Jocks or athletically-minded individuals in school might have terrorized those who played Magic or Mario, but some nerds have responded by heaping just as much abuse upon those among us who happen to enjoy a sports contest or two. And that’s just wrong. It’s perfectly normal for a guy or a girl who likes playing with elves and orcs to also enjoy a baseball game or, Cthulhu forbid, the Olympics. In this discussion of individuals who happen to be both geeks AND sports fanatics, we’ll talk about the similarities between sports and nerd culture - from the dedicated cosplayers to the unholy obsession with stats - and how we nerds should embrace sports fans as kindred spirits, not shun them as enemies. -- Panelists: Greg Tito [Senior Editor, The Escapist], R. A. Salvatore [Author], Jason Schreier [Kotaku], Rob Zacny [Freelance Journalist], Sean Sands [Gamers With Jobs]
Event.name: Dorks Vs. Sports

Event.description: Would you like to design and create your own games? Attend this workshop to learn the most important game design skills… by practicing them yourself! You will design, implement, test, and revise games during this workshop. Though the materials we use in the workshop will be analog (dice, cards, paper, pencil, etc.), the design principles you will employ are applicable to digital game design as well. -- Panelists: Ira Fay [Founder, Fay Games]
Event.name: Game Design Workshop

Event.description: Nostalgia plus new game play? Awwww yeah, good times. Every round you’ll be flying ‘til you can’t in dogfights. Best 2 of 3 moves on to the following round. Have fun going against old friends and new! (Unless they play as Slippy. You know why.)
Event.name: Star Fox 64 3D Tournament

Event.description: Are you as cool as the characters in PvP? Are you a Table Titans wannabe? Scott Kurtz’s Mines of Madness await! Hurl yourself into a deadly dungeon in search of the fabled Forever Stone, but beware the outhouse! This special D&D Next adventure is 4 hours long and designed for 3rd-level characters. In addition, you’ll be rating your Dungeon Masters to determine the best DM of PAX East 2013! Characters are provided.
Event.name: D&D Next DM’s Challenge: Mines of Madness

Event.description: Have you ever considered making your own board game? Or a line of minis? This panel will teach you how to become a modern day Milton Bradley using 3-D printers, Kickstarter, and the power of the internet. -- Panelists: Whether you want to make a DIY game board or turn an idea for a game into a business, the experts on this panel will share lessons learned from shipping dozens of games, engaging thousands of fans, and raising millions of dollars through crowd funding.
Event.name: From Playtest to 3-D Printer: How to Make Your Own Board Game, War Game, or Tamagotchi

Event.description: Each player receives 6 boosters Gatecrash
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering Foil Fest

Event.description: Do you find it impossible to click with some esteemed gaming classic? Are you afraid to admit that you just don’t understand the following behind a beloved game that disappointed you in the past? Put those fears of ostracization aside, because the Retronauts are here to offer a safe place where dissing these golden greats won’t get you strung up like a pinata. Join 1UP’s regular Retronauts crew, and come prepared as they question the audience about the sacred cows these attendees despise, and either restore their faith, or approve of their hatred. -- Panelists: Bob Mackey [Freelance], Marty Sliva [Associate Editor, IGN], John Delia [COO, Retroware TV], Joey DeSena [Contributor, Retroware TV]
Event.name: Retro Games We Want to Love

Event.description: 1v1, 64 Player Cap
Event.name: Super Smash Bros. Brawl Tournament: Group A

Event.description: Producers of such fine internet entertainment as The Escapist’s Unskippable, PATV’s CheckPoint, the Desert Bus for Hope fundraiser, and Penny Arcade’s own reality show Strip Search, select members of LoadingReadyRun will be on hand to show you new stuff and answer your questions! Come and hang out, it’s a grand time! -- Panelists: The LoadingReadyRun Crew!
Event.name: The LoadingReadyRun Panel

Event.description: Gaming’s biggest event producers share best kept secrets on how to work the party scene and network your way to that dream job. If you have a passion for gaming, you can make it your profession. Join this panel of industry all-stars as they talk about how they broke into the business, and answer your questions on how you can too. -- Panelists: Martine Paris [Director, PR & Marketing, Outspark], Amber Dalton [Director, Marketing & Events, TwitchTV], Kevin Van Ness [Head of Community, Wargaming], Will Boyer [Director of Marketing, Curse], Warren Price [Game Designer, Electronic Arts], Rey Gutierrez [Video Director, Sony PlayStation], Amy Brady [Senior Frag Doll, Marketing & Promotions, Ubisoft], Omar Abdelwahed [Senior Online Producer, 2K]
Event.name: Twister Tales: Breaking Into Gaming & Partying On!

Event.description: Mega64 has made it to its ten year anniversary. The fact that the whole crew got there all still alive and not behind bars is something to celebrate in and of itself. Come join the party with the entire Mega64 gang as we show some new videos, reminisce on some old ones, and do some Q&A to ring in this joyous occasion.
Event.name: Mega64 Panel, Sorted!

Event.description: Standard Action, the comedy-fantasy webseries for geeks of all kinds, is in its second season! Come and see a screening of some of their new Season 2 material, and ask the creator questions about how the team makes this hilariously nerdy, award-winning show. Plus learn about their new card game, old-school MMO, and upcoming RPG module! -- Panelists: Joanna Gaskell [Producer/Writer/Actor, Critical Success Productions], Rob Hunt [Director/Cinematographer/Editor, Critical Success Productions]
Event.name: Standard Action: the Webseries - Season 2!

Event.description: FFA, 100 Player Cap
Event.name: Minecraft Tournament

Event.description: 1v1 32 Player Cap
Event.name: NBA Jam Tournament

Event.description: Chances are you’ve got one of those smart phone doohickeys, meaning you know what we mean when we say there are some really incredible games being developed for the platform. Many of these have begun to transcend the casual/social stigma, as games for the hardcore start to rival the experiences found on dedicated hardware. Unfortunately while there are all sorts of indie game competitions out there, not many seem to focus specifically on the mobile platforms… and that seemed like a problem we might be able to help with. Join the creators of those games LIVE and on stage! Questions will be asked! Answers may appear!
Event.name: PAX East Indie Showcase

Event.description: You’ve been exploring in the sub-basement of the old convention center. You’ve been smart and careful, but somehow you got turned around. There’s a weird glow coming from under the door across the way, and is that blood on the wall? Vincent and Meguey Baker will lead the room through a game of Murderous Ghosts involving you, the audience. Can you escape before whatever is down here gets you? -- Panelists: Meguey Baker [Owner, Night Sky Games], Vincent Baker [Owner, lumpley games]
Event.name: Audience Participation Murderous Ghosts - a role-playing game with ghosts and murder

Event.description: Get ready to match the stars! Join a hilarious collection of writers, pundits, and comedians for Blankety Blank, the live version of classic TV game show Match Game. Members of the audience will be selected as contestants and challenged to predict how the panelists will answer excessively silly questions. Whoever matches the most answers wins! For a raucous hour of raunchy fun, stop by - and bring your sense of humor. Part of Game Show Night at PAX East 2013! -- Panelists: Susan Arendt [Editor in Chief, The Escapist], Dan Amrich [Community Manager, Activision], Chris Kohler [Editor, Game|Life], Russ Pitts [Features Editor, Polygon], Graham Stark [Bon Vivant, Loading Ready Run], Kathleen DeVere [Snark Machine, Loading Ready Run], Mike Laidlaw [Creative Director, BioWare]
Event.name: Blankety Blank!

Event.description: Dungeon World is an award-winning tabletop roleplaying game, so how do the designers come up with classes, monsters, and rules? Come find out! Sit down with Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel, the designers of Dungeon World, as they work with the audience to create new Dungeon World material. Get a look behind the scenes into the creative process and see what comes out of it. -- Panelists: Sage LaTorra [Designer, Sage Kobold Productions], Adam Koebel [Designer, Sage Kobold Productions]
Event.name: Dungeon World: Make Stuff

Event.description: This panel is all about curing chemicals- plastics, resins, urethane rubbers, plasters, and silicones. Anything that cures. We’re going to take you through the basics. If you are a super noob or slightly more experienced to advanced you’ll fit in here. Cosplay and costuming has gotten pretty crazy in the last few years and curing chemicals have played a major part. If you want your costumes to be fantastic, you’ll want to stop by. From Cerberus Productions, Lindsay is a professional promotional model and costumer with help from relative newcomers Sharece and Shelby also of Cerberus and casting genius, Alyssa from Propped Up Creations. -- Panelists: And the biggest thing we need to stress is that ANYONE CAN COSTUME.
Event.name: Introduction to Curing Chemicals and Special Effects Costuming

Event.description: At PAX Prime the SmashMuck Champions developers had an unprecedented opportunity - we let the audience design a Champion live, and then we put it in the game! Now we’re taking our panel to Boston and ready to see what the East Coast can do. Offense? Defense? Support? Laser? Shapeshifting? Awesome Mode? YOU are making the design choices for this wacky indie MOBA while listening in on dev secrets, getting your questions answered and, of course, there is lots of swag. -- Panelists: Jose Mejia [Community Manager, Kiz Studios], Ben Rodgers [Lead Designer, Kiz Studios], Jacob Schieck [Lead Programmer, Kiz Studios], Allen White [Art Director, Kiz Studios], Ashlee Vaughn [Communications Director, Kiz Studios]
Event.name: No, the Monkey Should have a chainsaw: Design Choices in an Indie MOBA

Event.description: Come one, come all! It’s time for the PAX EAST 2013 CONCERT LINEUP! Friday night it’s VGO, Those Who Fight and Protomen! -- Panelists: PAX East Musical Guests
Event.name: Friday Night Concerts

Event.description: 1v1, 64 Player Cap
Event.name: Super Smash Bros. Brawl Tournament: Group B

Event.description: With over 10,000 Vanity Metrics (VidScore Reporting, Sept. 2012) of combined, practical, real-world know-how, know-who, and know-when, the Giant Bomb High Taste Grandmasters hand you the keys to unlock your inner SEO and make the most of leveraged buzz, you stupid idiot! -- Panelists: Vinny Caravella [Giant Bomb], Ryan Davis [Giant Bomb], Jeff Gerstmann [Giant Bomb], Patrick Klepek [Giant Bomb], Alex Navarro [Giant Bomb], Brad Shoemaker [Giant Bomb]
Event.name: How To Energize Business and Millennial Brand Focus: A Giant Bomb Panel Eduknowledgement Experience

Event.description: This…is…Jeopardy! Well, no it’s not; since all the answers and questions are going to be about gaming and geek culture, it’s more like Mild Peril. We will be taking contestants from PAX attendees, so bring your thinking caps to this panel. Just don’t wear anything that will clash with host Dan Amrich’s incredibly blinding red jacket. Part of Game Show Night at PAX East 2013! -- Panelists: Dan Amrich [Community Manager, Activision]
Event.name: Game Show Night: Jeopardy!

Event.description: We surveyed 100 gamers… can you guess their responses? Everybody’s favorite game show about families getting into arguments on television and husbands just having to smile and nod as Richard Dawson makes out with their wives is now a live PAX show. Random audience members will be organized into impromptu families and pitted against other audience members. Guess the most popular answers to our questions and you’ll win fabulous prizes! -- Panelists: Chris Kohler [Editor, Wired], Regina Wu [Intel, Engineer]
Event.name: Game Show Night: Family Feud!
